articles.title: Mozambique : Surge in Violence Pushes Children to the Breaking Point in Northern
articles.summary: New York/Maputo ‚Äî Tens of thousands of children displaced as families forced to flee in wake of attacks by armed non-state actors Over 100,000 people, around two thirds of them children, have been displaced in northern Mozambique during the month of November, following attacks against civilians. articles.title: Somalia Disaster Management Head Appeals to Donors Over Severe Drought
articles.summary: Mogadishu, Somalia ‚Äî The Chairman of Somalia's National Disaster Management Agency (SoDMA), Mohamud Moallim Abdulle, held a crucial virtual meeting on Thursday with international donors from the European Union, the United States, and the United Nations to discuss the worsening drought across the country. articles.title: Residents spend night away from Derby homes after major incident
articles.summary: Hundreds of evacuated residents allowed back home 12 hours ago Share Save Dan Hunt and Jude Winter , East Midlands Share Save BBC Residents were evacuated on Thursday from the Vulcan Street area of Derby Residents evacuated from 200 properties in Derby are being allowed back into their homes, a day after a major incident was declared. articles.title: Road accident deaths rise to 1 . 77 lakh in 2024 : Gadkari
